name: film
summary: Stores detailed information about individual films available in a video rental store or similar catalog.
purpose: This table serves as the central repository for all core attributes of a film, including its title, description, release details, rental terms, and associated costs. It supports inventory management, customer browsing, and rental transaction processing by providing comprehensive film data.
dependencies_thoughts: This table directly relates to the `language` table, with two foreign keys: `language_id` for the primary language of the film and `original_language_id` for its original language, allowing for multilingual film data management. Records in this table are dependent on valid entries in the `language` table.

columns.description: The unique numerical identifier for each film. This is the primary key for the table, automatically generated.
The official title of the film.
A brief summary or synopsis of the film's plot or content.
The year in which the film was originally released.
The numerical identifier for the primary language of the film. This is a foreign key referencing the 'language' table.
The numerical identifier for the original language of the film, if different from the primary language. This is an optional foreign key referencing the 'language' table.
The default number of days a film can be rented, with a default of 3 days.
The cost per day for renting the film, with a default of 4.99.
The running time of the film in minutes.
The cost to replace the film if it is lost or damaged, with a default of 19.99.
The MPAA rating of the film (e.g., G, PG, PG-13, R, NC-17), with a default of 'G'.
The timestamp of the last time the film's record was updated, automatically set to the current time.
An array of text strings listing any special features included with the film (e.g., 'Trailers', 'Commentaries').
A pre-computed tsvector for efficient full-text searching across film titles and descriptions.
